name: SmarterQueue
description:

Effortlessly manage all your social accounts, with content curation, scheduling, engagement, inbox and analytics in one intuitive platform.

Trusted by 1000s of brands and entrepreneurs, SmarterQueue saves users on average 8+ hours a week and boosts engagement by 10x.

jobs.title: FrontEnd Developer - Remote
jobs.description:
üö®Please read carefully before applying. This position is 100% remote üåçYour availability must have a minimum of 3 hours overlap with Pacific Timezone (PST)
------------------

ABOUT US
SmarterQueue is a ground-breaking social media tool.

On average, our platform saves Customers over 8 hours per week, and increases the effectiveness of their social media content up to 300%.

We are a small fully remote team, spanning the UK, Canada, America and Europe, building a tool which adds real value to influencers and marketers lives.

ABOUT THE ROLE
You will be involved in developing new features, internal tools, bug fixing, and helping customers with issues that have been escalated to the dev team. You will be required to write well tested code that matches designs & specifications.

Our back-end codebase is PHP (using Symfony 4) and our front-end is built with JavaScript / jQuery. We have modern practices in place (Docker, cloud hosting, unit/integration/acceptance testing, etc) and are constantly improving things to develop more efficiently.

This is a remote, full-time position that can be performed in any timezone, as long as it overlaps a few hours with the Pacific Timezone.

ABOUT YOU
- Attention to detail - you think about edge cases, your implementation matches the designs, your code handles garbage data!
- Great communicator - you don't miss meetings or notifications, and respond quickly
- Love to work independently - you‚Äôre welcome to ask questions as often as necessary, but should be able to complete work on time without having to be chased
- Remote worker - you‚Äôre happy being part of a remote team, using Slack to keep connected, and with weekly team calls using Google Meet

Required Skills/Experience
- Near pixel perfect attention to detail.
- HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery.
- ECMAScript 2015+ (aka ES6+).
- Git.
- Social Media.

Bonus Points
- Modern JavaScript Framework (e.g. React, Vue, Angular).
- Typescript.
- Experience with PHP7.

SALARY
Negotiable, depending on expertise.

HOW TO APPLY
- Click apply and send us an intro note (or, even better an intro video), ensuring you've uploaded your resume and added your Linkedin profile URL 
- All applications without a complete Angel List profile and intro note, mentioning the phrase 'I AM NOT A ROBOT' will be immediately disqualified üòâ

‚ú®We‚Äôre actively looking for a diverse and gender-balanced team.

‚û°Ô∏èVisit https://smarterqueue.com for more information about the product.

jobs.title: Marketing Operations Specialist (100% Remote)
jobs.description:
üö®Please read carefully before applying:

‚úîÔ∏èThis position is 100% remote üåç
‚úîÔ∏èYour availability must have a minimum of 3 hours overlap with GMT


***ABOUT US***

SmarterQueue is a ground-breaking social media management tool.

On average, SmarterQueue increases the effectiveness of our customers social media content by up to 300%, and saves them over 8 hours per week - amongst many other incredible benefits!

We are a small fully remote team, spanning the UK, Canada, America and Europe. 

SmarterQueue is building software which adds REAL value to influencers and marketers lives!


***SALARY***

- Salary range USD $50K - $70K (dependent on experience)


***WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO***

- Your goal will be to develop and implement the most profitable strategies to acquire traffic to the SmarterQueue website, and to convert that traffic to trial users. *You will not have a team at this stage to execute on your vision. You must be a DOER!*
- Create marketing automations and achieve lead-generation targets.
- Optimise and improve user acquisition strategies, including top, mid and bottom of funnel content marketing, paid, SEO, and webinars.
- Create and constantly improve processes that drive and optimise marketing and lead generation productivity.
- Perform A/B tests, surveys, experiments, to optimise performance of landing pages, ads, onboarding, and product functionality.
- Know all the technical details of SmarterQueue, and translate them into benefits for the user.
- Lead and implement the full marketing strategy for SmarterQueue (SaaS product marketing, growth hacking etc).
- Lead the operation of the SmarterQueue website and content with an emphasis on increasing conversion.
- Establish the marketing budget and track return on investment.
- Get a deep understanding of our customer personas, and their user needs.
- Showcase SmarterQueue benefits as solutions to needs - targeted to specific niches, as well as generic messaging for all audiences.
- Create compelling marketing/sales copy and imagery to showcase SmarterQueue‚Äôs value, and increase the market‚Äôs perception of our value.
- Understand and document the buyer journey process. Then, drive changes to processes based on your learnings.
- Assess the effectiveness of marketing efforts and report to senior management.
- Work closely with other functions to ensure your strategic vision is aligned.
- Act as a SmarterQueue evangelist.


***ABOUT THE ROLE***

- Part-time or full time (25+ hours/week).
- You will work 100% remotely.
- You must have your own computer/equipment with a solid connection to the internet.

 
***REQUIREMENTS***

- 2+ years experience of SaaS/Product marketing
- In-depth understanding of SaaS analytics (conversion funnels, retention, A/B testing).
- Successful track record of managing and optimising funnels.
- Master of many marketing techniques; inbound and outbound marketing, ads and retargeting, email campaigns, sales copy, referral and affiliate programs, product videos, webinars, feature launches, and pricing strategies.
- Fluent in English, both verbal and written.
- Passion and complete understanding of social media. 
- Startup grit. You will be expected to deliver a lot, with little support.
- Exemplary attention to detail.
- Incredible, self managing organisational skills with the ability to multitask projects from start to finish.
- Strong verbal and written communication skills.
- Excellent interpersonal skills.
- Love and complete competence in independent and 100% remote working lifestyle.
- Team player and a positive, motivating person to be around.
- Creative and quantitative thinker. 
- Solid video creation and editing skills.
- User-centric mentality and ability to extract qualitative insights from user interactions.
- Experience creating email campaigns, automation, audience segmentation, and retargeting.
- Data-driven, with strong experience of experiments and analytics.
- Exceptional analytical skills in quantitative data analysis of program effectiveness, campaign testing, forecasting, and ROI.


***OUR HIRING PROCESS***

- We get hundreds of applicants each week, so unfortunately can't reply to unsuccessful applicants
- We immediately reject any applicants that didn't follow the instructions above.
- Promising applicants are then contacted, and invited to send a short video, answering a few questions.
- The next stage would be an initial video interview (either with a member of our team, or the CEO)
- Following that, there would be a more technical interview or assignment


***HOW TO APPLY***

‚úîÔ∏èClick to apply, and ensure you send us a brief intro note.
‚úîÔ∏èMake sure your resume is uploaded on AngelList, and your Linkedin URL is added to your AngelList profile.
‚úîÔ∏èAll applications without a complete AngelList profile and intro note will be immediately disqualified. 
‚úîÔ∏è To prove that you've read this far, start your intro note with three asterisks *** . Any application failing to do so will be immediately disqualified. Attention to detail matters. üòâ


***TIPS FOR SUCCESS***

- Don't write "I believe my skills and experience make me a good fit for this role". It's meaningless, as everyone writes that.
- Don't send a huge copy-paste intro note. 
- Do simply write a few sentences showing your relevant SaaS/marketing experience, and what hands-on skills you have.
- Do show us your knowledge of social media tools.
- A very short intro video will make you stand out

‚ú®We‚Äôre actively looking for a diverse and gender-balanced team.
‚û°Ô∏èVisit https://smarterqueue.com for more information about the product

------------------

ABOUT US
SmarterQueue is a ground-breaking social media tool.

On average, our platform saves Customers over 8 hours per week, and increases the effectiveness of their social media content up to 300%.

We are a small fully remote team, spanning the UK, Canada, America and Europe, building a tool which adds real value to influencers and marketers lives.

ABOUT THE ROLE
You will be part of the product team involved in manually testing new features and changes, ensuring the implementation matches the specifications, finding bugs, and regressions.
When not testing changes from the product team, you will be testing the existing functionality of the site ensuring everything is working as expected.

ABOUT YOU
- Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a Software Quality Assurance position (previous experience working on an in-house product is a plus)
- Experience testing both web and mobile apps (experience testing 3rd party integrations is a plus)
- Experience writing, maintaining and executing test plans
- Strong work ethic and quality-oriented
- Developed problem-solving skills, attention to detail and ability to learn fast
- High degree of flexibility, creativity and thoroughness
- Team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
- Strong understanding of full software lifecycle and all phases of QA process
- Basic knowledge of databases
- Previous experience working in a fast-changing startup environment is a plus

SALARY
Negotiable, depending on expertise.

- Click apply and send us an intro note (or, even better an intro video), ensuring you've uploaded your resume and added your Linkedin profile URL
